page.title: 04Tuffley People at Work.
page.content: 311 Tuffley residents answered questions about their work. The two largest groups were the 47 who do clerical work and the 40 shop assistants. There were 16 engineers and 14 mechanics. 12 are builders, 12 are teachers and 11 work in a hospital. Among others, there are 4 hairdressers, 4 electricians and 3 working with computers. There is therefore no dominant employer or type of work. 60 of the sample, represented 60 different jobs. These include a British Rail employee, a caretaker a casemaker, a fireman, a milkman, a plumber, a school crossing warden, a person engaged in looking after the elderly, a vicar, a welder and a wheelmaker.
